page.title: 09BOTANIC GARDENS NESTON
page.content: {Ness Gardens On 19th June "85" we went to Ness Gardens to interview Mr Cunnington. He said that the garden had been started in 1898 by a man called Arthur Kilpin Bulley who owned the sixty acres of land then. Now the University of Liverpool owns the gardens and it's used by the University for the teaching of students. The students are geneticists, botanists, geographers, biochemists and zoologists. Also it is open to the public all week. The staff of the gardens are paid but the Friends of Ness Gardens are voluntary workers. Each of the Friends of Ness Gardens has his or her own patch of garden and they look after that particular patch with pride.Staffing consists of 10 permanent,4 part time,2 office,2 Y.T.S.and 1 college person.0
